DataElement.preferredName: Patient Medical History Other Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the patient's medical records related to other neoplasm as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Other Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Other Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another active malignancy requiring treatment within the last 3 years or bone marrow dysplasia such as myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have another malignancy unless curatively treated with no evidence of disease for greater than or equal to 5 years except: adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in situ cancer of the cervix, ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), Stage 1, grade 1 endometrial carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have another active primary malignancy (other than non-melanomatous skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix) requiring treatment or limiting expected survival to less than or equal to 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active concurrent invasive malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another malignancy that could affect compliance with the protocol or interpretation of the results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of a second malignancy not treated with curative intent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient successfully undergone treatment for another, unrelated clinically relevant cancer less than or equal to 3 years post final treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have another malignancy unless curatively treated with no evidence of disease for greater than or equal to 5 years except: adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in situ cancer of the cervix, ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), Stage 1, grade 1 endometrial carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known additional malignancy (with the exception of prior hematologic malignancies that have transformed to AML) that is active and/or progressive requiring treatment; exceptions include basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, in situ cervical cancer or patients receiving maintenance treatments without active disease (for example, hormonal therapy for breast cancer or prostate cancer or other adjuvant chemotherapy approaches)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment, except for basal cell carcinoma of the skin, squamous cell carcinoma of the skin that has undergone potentially curative therapy, in situ cervical cancer, or low-risk prostate cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another primary malignancy except for: Malignancy treated with curative intent and with no active disease in greater than or equal to 5 years before the first dose of IP and of low potential risk for recurrence; or adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer or lentigo maligna without evidence of disease; or adequately treated any carcinoma in situ without evidence of disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have secondary active hematological malignancy including but not limited to CLL/SLL, Hodgkins lymphoma, non-Hodgkins lymphoma (NHL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy or recent treatment for a concurrent malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of malignancy other than ASPS prior to screening, with the exception of malignancies with a negligible risk of metastasis or death (e.g., 5-year OS rate greater than 90%), such as adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, localized prostate cancer, ductal carcinoma in situ, or Stage I uterine cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active additional malignancy or a personal history of additional malignancy that may affect outcome of disease under treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment, except for basal cell carcinoma of the skin, squamous cell carcinoma of the skin that has undergone potentially curative therapy, in situ cervical cancer, ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast, early-stage differentiated thyroid cancer or low-risk prostate cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of other malignancy with the exception of 1) malignancies for which all treatment was completed at least 2 years before registration and the patient has no evidence of disease; 2) or known indolent malignancies that do not require treatment and will likely not alter the course of treatment of disease under treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of other malignancy that could affect compliance with the protocol or interpretation of results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of other malignancies, except: adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cancer of the cervix, or other solid tumours curatively treated with no evidence of disease for â‰¥ 3 years.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_02
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of other malignancies, except: adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cancer of the cervix, or other solid tumours curatively treated with no evidence of disease for >= 3 years.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 10/31/23 Added AQT for CCTG ticket number CADSR0003018 cjl; 9/27/23 Added alt OID, CCTG and alt OID, CCTG cjl. 5/13/22 CJL AQT added for Theradex for protocol 10405
